full_text: Lea ine a Bian 2016/KER/61 IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM PRESENT: THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE B.KEMAL PASHA MONDAY, THE 4TH DAY OF JANUARY 2016/14TH POUSHA, 1937 Cri.MC.No. 7842 of 2015 CC 81/2010 OF CHIEF JUDICIAL MAGISTRATE COURT, KASARAGOD. CRIME NO. 192/2009 OF KASARAGOD POLICE STATION, KASARAGOD. PETITIONER(S)/ACCUSED: 1. N.A.MOIDEEN, AGED 55 YEARS, S/O.ABDULLA HAul, N.A.HOUSE, NAIMARMOOLA, MUTTATHODY VILLAGE, KASARAGOD. 2. MUHAMMED FAIZAL M.M, AGED 33 YEARS, S/O.ABOOBACKER, M.M MANZIL, PERVAD, KUMBALA POST, KASARAGOD. BY ADV. SRLS.JlJI RESPONDENT(S)/STATE & DEFACTO COMPLAINANT: 1. STATE OF KERALA, REPRESENTED BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM. 2. AHAMMED ASLAM, S/O.B.K.ABDUL KHADER, AGED 30 YEARS, KUNNIL HOUSE, ALAMPADY, BEVINJE POST, THEKKIL FERRY, CHENGALA VILLAGE, KASARAGOD - 671541. R1 BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR SMT.SAREENA GEORGE R2_ BY ADV. SMT.K.S.SANTHI THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 04-01-2016, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: mbr PaLsgeaahl gabon aes 2016/KER/61 Cri.MC.No. 7842 of 2015 APPENDIX PETITIONER(S)' ANNEXURES: ANNEXURE At: TRUE COPY OF THE FIR IN CR.NO.192/2009 OF KASARAGOD POLICE STATION. ANNEXURE A2: CERTIFIED COPY OF THE FINAL REPORT IN CR.NO.192/2009 OF KASARAGOD POLICE STATION. ANNEXURE A3: AFFIDAVIT DATED 12.06.2015 SWORN BY THE 2ND RESPONDENT. RESPONDENT(S) ANNEXURES: NIL ITRUE COPY// P.S. TO JUDGE mbr/ aL pete hal 2016/KER/61 B. KEMAL PASHA, J. ORDER Petitioners are accused in C.C. No.81 of 2010 of the Chief Judicial Magistrate's Court, Kasaragod, which has arisen from Crime No.192 of 2009 of the Kasaragod Police Station, registered for the offences punishable under Sections 419, 420, 423, 465 and 468 of the Indian Penal Code read with Section 34 IPC. 2. The matter has been amicably settled between the petitioners and the defacto complainant, who is the 2 respondent herein. The defacto complainant has filed Annexure-A3. affidavit affirming that the matter has been amicably settled between him and the petitioners and he has no complaints against the petitioners. 3. No criminal antecedents have been reported against the petitioners. When the matter has been amicably PaLsgeiesrl ieee 2016/KER/61 CRL.M.C.No. 7842 of 2015 2: setiled, no purpose would be served in proceeding with the matter further, and therefore, all further proceedings in C.C. No.81 of 2010 pending before the Chief Judicial Magistrate's Court, Kasaragod, as against the petitioners, based on Annexure-A2 Final Report in Crime No.192 of 2009 of the Kasaragod Police Station, can be quashed. In the result, this Crl.M.C. is allowed and all further proceedings in C.C. No.81 of 2010 pending before the Chief Judicial Magistrate's Court, Kasaragod, as against the petitioners, based on Annexure-A2 Final Report in Crime No.192 of 2009 of the Kasaragod Police Station, are hereby quashed. Sd/- B. KEMAL PASHA, JUDGE. DSV/4/1/16 [True copy] PS. to Judge
